59   | /** 				    LOCAL DATA				     **/
60   | /** ************************************************************************ **/
61   | 
62   | static char error_module[ MOD_BUFSIZE];
63   | static	char	module_name[] = __FILE__;
64   | 
65   | /** ************************************************************************ **/
66   | /**				    PROTOTYPES				     **/
67   | /** ************************************************************************ **/
68   | 
69   | /** not applicable **/
70   | 
71   | 
72   | /*++++
73   |  ** ** Function-Header ***************************************************** **
74   |  ** 									     **
75   |  **   Function:		checkConflict					     **
76   |  ** 									     **
77   |  **   Description:	Check whether the 'g_current_module' is in the list  **
78   |  **			of passed modules				     **
79   |  ** 									     **
80   |  **   First Edition:	1991/10/23					     **
81   |  ** 									     **
82   |  **   Parameters:	Tcl_Interp	*interp		According Tcl interp.**
83   |  **			char		*path		Modulepath to be chk.**
84   |  **			char		**modulelist	List of loaded mod.  **
85   |  **			int		 nummodules	Number of loaded mod.**
86   |  ** 									     **
87   |  **   Result:		int	TCL_OK		Successful completion	     **
88   |  **				TCL_ERROR	Any error		     **
89   |  ** 									     **
90   |  **   Attached Globals:	g_flags		These are set up accordingly before  **
91   |  **					this function is called in order to  **
92   |  **					control everything		     **
93   |  **									     **
94   |  **		  	g_current_module	Module to check for	     **
95   |  ** 									     **
96   |  ** ************************************************************************ **
97   |  ++++*/
98   | 
99   | static int checkConflict(
100  | 	Tcl_Interp * interp,
101  | 	char *path,
102  | 	char **modulelist,
103  | 	unsigned int nummodules
104  | ) {
105  | 	uvec           *new_modulelist;
106  | 	int             new_nummodules, k;
107  | 	struct stat     stat_info;
108  | 	char           *buffer;
109  | 
110  | 	memset(error_module, '\0', MOD_BUFSIZE);
111  | 
112  |     /**
113  |      **  Check all modules passed to me as parameter
114  |      **  At first clarify if they really so exist ...
115  |      **/
116  | 	for (k = 0; k < nummodules; k++) {
117  | 		if ((char *)NULL == (buffer = stringer(NULL, 0,
118  | 		path, "/", modulelist[k], NULL)))
119  | 			if (OK != ErrorLogger(ERR_STRING, LOC, NULL))
120  | 				goto unwind0;
121  | 		if (stat(buffer, &stat_info) < 0) {
122  | 			if (OK !=
123  | 			    ErrorLogger(ERR_FILEINDIR, LOC, modulelist[k], path,
124  | 					NULL))
125  | 				if ((char *)NULL ==
126  | 				    stringer(error_module, MOD_BUFSIZE,
127  | 					     modulelist[k], NULL))
128  | 					if (OK !=
129  | 					    ErrorLogger(ERR_STRING, LOC, NULL))
130  | 						goto unwind1;
131  | 			goto unwind1;
132  | 		}
133  | 
134  | 	/**
135  | 	 **  Is it a directory what has been passed? If it is, list the
136  | 	 **  according directory and call myself recursively in order to
137  | 	 **/
138  | 
139  | 		if (S_ISDIR(stat_info.st_mode)) {
140  | 
141  | 			if (NULL == (new_modulelist = SortedDirList(path,
142  | 			modulelist[k], &new_nummodules)))
143  | 				continue;
144  | 
145  | 			if (TCL_ERROR == checkConflict(interp, path,
146  | 			uvec_vector(new_modulelist), new_nummodules)) {
147  | 				FreeList(&new_modulelist);
148  | 				goto unwind1;
149  | 			}
150  | 			FreeList(&new_modulelist);
151  | 	/**
152  | 	 **  If it isn't a directory, check the current one for to be the
153  | 	 **  required module file
154  | 	 **/
155  | 		} else {
156  | 			if (IsLoaded_ExactMatch
157  | 			    (interp, modulelist[k], NULL, NULL)
158  | 			    && strcmp(g_current_module, modulelist[k])) {
159  | 
160  | 		/**
161  |                  **  Save the name of the offending module in a buffer
162  |                  **  for reporting purposes when we get back to the top.
163  |                  **/
164  | 
165  | 				if ((char *)NULL ==
166  | 				    stringer(error_module, MOD_BUFSIZE,
167  | 					     modulelist[k], NULL))
168  | 					if (OK !=
169  | 					    ErrorLogger(ERR_STRING, LOC, NULL))
170  | 						goto unwind1;
171  | 				goto unwind1;
172  | 			}
173  | 
174  | 		} /** if( directory) **/
175  | 	} /** for **/
176  |     /**
177  |      ** free resources
178  |      **/
179  | 	null_free((void *)&buffer);
180  | 
181  | 	return (TCL_OK);		/** -------- EXIT (SUCCESS) -------> **/
182  | 
183  | unwind1:
184  | 	null_free((void *)&buffer);
185  | unwind0:
186  | 	return (TCL_ERROR);		/** -------- EXIT (FAILURE) -------> **/
187  | 
188  | } /** End of 'checkConflict' **/
189  | 
190  | /*++++
191  |  ** ** Function-Header ***************************************************** **
192  |  ** 									     **
193  |  **   Function:		cmdConflict					     **
194  |  ** 									     **
195  |  **   Description:	Callback function for 'conflict'		     **
196  |  ** 									     **
197  |  **   First Edition:	1991/10/23					     **
198  |  ** 									     **
199  |  **   Parameters:	ClientData	 client_data			     **
200  |  **			Tcl_Interp	*interp		According Tcl interp.**
201  |  **			int		 objc		Number of arguments  **
202  |  **			Tcl_Obj		*objv[]		Argument array	     **
203  |  ** 									     **
204  |  **   Result:		int	TCL_OK		Successful completion	     **
205  |  **				TCL_ERROR	Any error		     **
206  |  ** 									     **
207  |  **   Attached Globals:	g_flags		These are set up accordingly before  **
208  |  **					this function is called in order to  **
209  |  **					control everything		     **
210  |  ** 									     **
211  |  ** ************************************************************************ **
212  |  ++++*/
213  | 
214  | int cmdConflict(
215  | 	ClientData client_data,
216  | 	Tcl_Interp * interp,
217  | 	int objc,
218  | 	Tcl_Obj * CONST84 objv[]
219  | ) {
220  | 	uvec           *pathlist,	/** List of module-pathes	     **/
221  | 	               *modulelist;	/** List of modules		     **/
222  | 	int             i, j,		/** Loop counters		     **/
223  | 	                numpaths, nummodules;
224  | 					/** Size of the according arrays     **/
225  |     /**
226  |      **  Whatis mode
227  |      **/
228  | 	if (g_flags & (M_WHATIS | M_HELP))
229  | 		goto success0;
230  |     /**
231  |      **  Check the parameters. Usage is 'conflict <module> [<module> ...]'
232  |      **/
233  | 	if (objc < 2)
234  | 		if (OK != ErrorLogger(ERR_USAGE, LOC, Tcl_GetString(objv[0]),
235  | 				      "conflicting-modulefiles", NULL))
236  | 			goto unwind0;
237  |     /**
238  |      **  There will be no conflicts in case of switch or unload
239  |      **/
240  | 	if (g_flags & (M_REMOVE | M_SWITCH))
241  | 		goto success0;
242  |     /**
243  |      **  Load the MODULEPATH and split it into a list of paths. Assume success
244  |      **  if no list to be built...
245  |      **/
246  | 	if (!(pathlist = ModulePathList()))
247  | 		goto unwind0;
248  | 	numpaths = uvec_number(pathlist);
249  | 	if (!numpaths)
250  | 		goto success1;
251  |     /**
252  |      **  Non-persist mode?
253  |      **/
254  | 	if (g_flags & M_NONPERSIST) {
255  | 		return (TCL_OK);
256  | 	}
257  |     /**
258  |      **  Display?
259  |      **/
260  | 	if (g_flags & M_DISPLAY) {
261  | 		fprintf(stderr, "%s\t ", Tcl_GetString(*objv++));
262  | 		while (--objc)
263  | 			fprintf(stderr, "%s ", Tcl_GetString(*objv++));
264  | 		fprintf(stderr, "\n");
265  | 		goto success1;
266  | 	}
267  |     /**
268  |      **  Now check/display all passed modules ...
269  |      **/
270  | 	for (i = 1; i < objc && Tcl_GetString(objv[i]); i++) {
271  | 		for (j = 0; j < numpaths; j++) {
272  | 			modulelist = SortedDirList(uvec_vector(pathlist)[j],
273  | 				   Tcl_GetString(objv[i]), &nummodules);
274  | 			if (modulelist && !uvec_number(modulelist)) {
275  | 				FreeList(&modulelist);
276  | 				continue; /** not browseable		     **/
277  | 			}
278  | 	    /**
279  | 	     **  Actually checking for conflicts is done here
280  | 	     **/
281  | 			if (TCL_ERROR ==
282  | 			    checkConflict(interp, uvec_vector(pathlist)[j],
283  | 					  uvec_vector(modulelist), nummodules))
284  | 				if (OK != ErrorLogger(ERR_CONFLICT, LOC,
285  | 				g_current_module, error_module, NULL)) {
286  | 					FreeList(&modulelist);
287  | 					goto unwind1;
288  | 				}
289  | 	    /**
290  | 	     **  Free the list of modules used in the loops body above.
291  | 	     **/
292  | 			FreeList(&modulelist);
293  | 		} /** for( j) **/
294  | 	} /** for( i) **/
295  |     /**
296  |      ** free resources
297  |      **/
298  | success1:
299  | 	FreeList(&pathlist);
300  | success0:
301  | 	return (TCL_OK);		/** -------- EXIT (SUCCESS) -------> **/
302  | unwind1:
303  | 	FreeList(&pathlist);
304  | unwind0:
305  | 	return (TCL_ERROR);		/** -------- EXIT (FAILURE) -------> **/
306  | } /** End of 'cmdConflict' **/
307  | 
308  | /*++++
309  |  ** ** Function-Header ***************************************************** **
310  |  ** 									     **
311  |  **   Function:		cmdPrereq					     **
312  |  ** 									     **
313  |  **   Description:	Callback function for 'prereq'			     **
314  |  ** 									     **
315  |  **   First Edition:	1991/10/23					     **
316  |  ** 									     **
317  |  **   Parameters:	ClientData	 client_data			     **
318  |  **			Tcl_Interp	*interp		According Tcl interp.**
319  |  **			int		 objc		Number of arguments  **
320  |  **			Tcl_Obj		*objv[]		Argument array	     **
321  |  ** 									     **
322  |  **   Result:		int	TCL_OK		Successful completion	     **
323  |  **				TCL_ERROR	Any error		     **
324  |  ** 									     **
325  |  **   Attached Globals:	g_flags		These are set up accordingly before  **
326  |  **					this function is called in order to  **
327  |  **					control everything		     **
328  |  ** 									     **
329  |  ** ************************************************************************ **
330  |  ++++*/
331  | 
332  | int cmdPrereq(
333  | 	ClientData client_data,
334  | 	Tcl_Interp * interp,
335  | 	int objc,
336  | 	Tcl_Obj * CONST84 objv[]
337  | ) {
338  | 	uvec          **savedlists = (uvec **) NULL;
339  | 	int            *savedlens = (int *)NULL;
340  | 	uvec           *pathlist,		/** module path list **/
341  | 	               *modulelist;		/** sorted module list **/
342  | 	char           *notloaded_flag;		/** missing module **/
343  | 	int             i, j, k, numpaths, nummodules, listcnt = 0,
344  | 	    Result = TCL_OK;
345  | 	char            buffer[MOD_BUFSIZE];
346  | 
347  |     /** 
348  |      **  Parameter check. Usage is 'prereq <module> [<module> ...]'
349  |      **/
350  | 	if (objc < 2)
351  | 		if (OK != ErrorLogger(ERR_USAGE, LOC, Tcl_GetString(objv[0]),
352  | 				      "prerequisite-modules", NULL))
353  | 			goto unwind0;
354  |     /**
355  |      **  There's no prerequisite check in case of removal
356  |      **/
357  | 	if (g_flags & (M_REMOVE | M_WHATIS))
358  | 		goto success0;
359  |     /**
360  |      **  Non-persist mode?
361  |      **/
362  | 	if (g_flags & M_NONPERSIST) {
363  | 		return (TCL_OK);
364  | 	}
365  |     /**
366  |      **  Display mode
367  |      **/
368  | 	if (g_flags & M_DISPLAY) {
369  | 		fprintf(stderr, "%s\t ", Tcl_GetString(*objv++));
370  | 		while (--objc)
371  | 			fprintf(stderr, "%s ", Tcl_GetString(*objv++));
372  | 		fprintf(stderr, "\n");
373  | 		goto success0;
374  | 	}
375  |     /**
376  |      **  Load the MODULEPATH and split it into a list of paths. Assume success
377  |      **  if no list to be built...
378  |      **/
379  | 	if (!(pathlist = ModulePathList()))
380  | 		goto unwind0;
381  | 	numpaths = uvec_number(pathlist);
382  | 	if (!numpaths)
383  | 		goto success1;
384  |     /**
385  |      **  Allocate memory for the lists of conflict modules
386  |      **/
387  | 	if (!(savedlists
388  | 	= (uvec **) module_malloc(numpaths * (objc - 1) * sizeof(uvec *))))
389  | 		if (OK != ErrorLogger(ERR_ALLOC, LOC, NULL))
390  | 			goto unwind0;
391  | 	if (!(savedlens
392  | 	= (int *)module_malloc(numpaths * (objc - 1) * sizeof(int))))
393  | 		if (OK != ErrorLogger(ERR_ALLOC, LOC, NULL))
394  | 			goto unwind1;
395  |     /**
396  |      **  Check/Display all passed modules
397  |      **/
398  | 	notloaded_flag = Tcl_GetString(objv[1]);
399  | 	for (i = 1; i < objc && Tcl_GetString(objv[i]) && notloaded_flag; i++) {
400  | 		for (j = 0; j < numpaths && notloaded_flag; j++) {
401  | 			modulelist = SortedDirList(uvec_vector(pathlist)[j],
402  | 				Tcl_GetString(objv[i]), &nummodules);
403  | 			if (modulelist && !uvec_number(modulelist)) {
404  | 				FreeList(&modulelist);
405  | 				continue;
406  | 			}
407  | 	    /**
408  | 	     **  save the list of files to be printed in case of missing pre-
409  | 	     **  requisites or 
410  | 	     **/
411  | 			savedlens[listcnt] = nummodules;
412  | 			savedlists[listcnt++] = modulelist;
413  | 	    /**
414  | 	     **  Now actually check if the prerequisites are fullfilled
415  | 	     **  The notloaded_flag controls the exit from both loops in case
416  | 	     **  a prerequisite is missing.
417  | 	     **/
418  | 			for (k = 0; k < nummodules && notloaded_flag; k++) {
419  | 				if (!IsLoaded
420  | 				    (interp, uvec_vector(modulelist)[k], NULL,
421  | 				     NULL)) {
422  | 					notloaded_flag = Tcl_GetString(objv[i]);
423  | 				} else {
424  | 					notloaded_flag = NULL;
425  | 				}
426  | 			}
427  | 		} /** for( j) **/
428  | 	} /** for( i) **/
429  |     /**
430  |      **  Display an error message if this was *NOT* display mode and a
431  |      **  missing prerequisite has been found
432  |      **/
433  | 	if (notloaded_flag) {
434  | 	/**
435  | 	 **  Add the whole list of prerequired module files to the Tcl result
436  | 	 **  string
437  | 	 **/
438  | 		for (k = 0; k < listcnt; k++) {
439  | 			uvec           *listptr = savedlists[k];
440  | 
441  | 			*buffer = '\0';
442  | 			for (i = 0; listptr && i < savedlens[k];i++) {
443  | 				if (!stringer(buffer + strlen(buffer),
444  | 					MOD_BUFSIZE - strlen(buffer),
445  | 					uvec_vector(listptr)[i], " ", NULL)) {
446  | 					if (OK != ErrorLogger(ERR_STRING, LOC,
447  | 							      NULL)) {
448  | 						/* not completely clean */
449  | 						goto unwind2;
450  | 					}
451  | 				}
452  | 			}
453  | 			FreeList(savedlists + k);
454  | 		}
455  | 
456  | 		if (strlen(buffer) > 0)			/* remove last blank */
457  | 			buffer[strlen(buffer) - 1] = '\0';
458  | 
459  | 		if (OK != ErrorLogger(ERR_PREREQ, LOC, g_current_module, buffer,
460  | 				      NULL))
461  | 			Result = TCL_ERROR;
462  | 	} else {
463  | 	/**
464  | 	 **  We have to free the saved module names again
465  | 	 **/
466  | 		for (k = 0; k < listcnt; k++)
467  | 			FreeList(savedlists + k);
468  | 	}
469  |     /**
470  |      **  Free up the list of prerequisites and return ...
471  |      **/
472  | 	null_free((void *)&savedlens);
473  | 	null_free((void *)&savedlists);
474  | 
475  | success1:
476  | 	FreeList(&pathlist);
477  | success0:
478  | 	return (Result);		/** -------- EXIT (Result)  -------> **/
479  | 
480  | unwind2:
481  | 	null_free((void *)&savedlens);
482  | unwind1:
483  | 	null_free((void *)&savedlists);
484  | unwind0:
485  | 	return (TCL_ERROR);		/** -------- EXIT (FAILURE) -------> **/
486  | } /** End of 'cmdPrereq' **/
